context: There were <b5_0>112,608<b5_0/> households in the city in 2000, of which <a0_0><b6_0><b8_0>26.5%<b8_0/><b6_0/><a0_0/> included children below the age of 18, 39.5% were composed of <a1_0>married couples living together<a1_0/>, 11.4% reported a female householder with no husband present, and 45.5% classified themselves as nonfamily. Unmarried partners were present in 2.2% of households. In addition, <a2_0><b7_0>33.1%<b7_0/><a2_0/> of all households were composed of individuals living alone, of which <a3_0><b9_0>6.2%<b9_0/><a3_0/> was someone 65 years of age or older. The average household size in Raleigh was 2.30 persons, and the average family size was <a4_0>2.97 persons.
